title: Danielle Lloyd wasn't shocked by Rebekah Vardy allegations by Coleen Rooney
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Danielle Lloyd has doubled down on her claims Rebekah Vardy is responsible for selling fake stories on Coleen Rooney live on This Morning.

Coleen, 33, sent the internet into meltdown yesterday when she claimed she had uncovered Jamie Vardy’s wife Rebekah as the culprit behind fake stories being sold to the press.

The issue became a topic of discussion on ITV’s This Morning, where hosts Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby asked Danielle Lloyd and Lizzie Cundy on the matter.

Despite Rebekah denying the allegations, Danielle believes she is responsible – after claiming she’s had past troubles with her.

Coleen and Rebekah kicked off a feud yesterday (Picture: Getty/ITV/Rex)

Speaking on the show, Danielle said: ‘I wasn’t as shocked. Because I’ve had run-ins with Rebekah before over similar things, so I wasn’t as shocked.

‘Obviously like everybody else you read it and you think, “Oh my gosh,” but I wasn’t as shocked seeing who it actually allegedly was.’

Asked whether she believes Rebekah is responsible, Danielle replied: ‘It’s definitely come from Becky’s account so who was it?

‘I think she did it. Sadly I really do. I think it’s a shame because she probably never thought she was going to get caught out.’

Lizzie Cundy and Danielle Lloyd on This Morning (Picture: ITV)

Asked for what reasons, Danielle said: ‘It’s obviously not the money, I think it’s the press issue. I think she thought maybe if she was feeding the press stories, she would maybe get more headlines for herself. I honestly don’t know.

‘I could never do that to somebody.’

Lizzie believes Coleen must have evidence to believe she’s responsible to out her in such a public way, adding: ‘It doesn’t mean you’re guilty just because you have friends who are journalists. I do a radio show with one but it doesn’t mean you’re doing that.

‘I think Coleen had to find the truth and I don’t think she would have gone to the measures of going and outing her unless she had concrete evidence.’

After making the claims live on air, Rebekah has since denied Danielle’s accusations they had ‘similar run-ins’ with a particularly scathing tweet.

‘‘Danielle Lloyd making false claims on @thismorning that we have had “similar run-ins” is utter boll**ks,’ Rebekah wrote.

‘She is just fuming that I “didn’t get Jamie recruiting” for her like she asked me to…’

Danielle previously posted numerous rat emojis as the news broke in response to the post.

Rebekah is currently pregnant with her fifth child, her second with footballer husband Jamie.

She grew close to Coleen when their husbands played alongside each other for England.

You can catch This Morning weekdays on ITV at 10.30am.
